intro: Tomanthea froedinii, commonly known as the East African orchid, is a striking member of the Orchidaceae family native to Tanzania and Kenya. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and large, showy flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in regions with high altitude and well-drained soils. Its unique floral structure includes a spurred lip, a feature common in many orchid species. Tomanthea froedinii is a rare and specialized plant, highlighting the rich botanical diversity of East African flora.
